greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of tree-rooted loopless planar maps with n edges, k faces and no isthmuses, n >= 0, k = 1..n+1.
comment: The number of vertices is n + 2 - k.
For k >= 2, column k without the initial zero term is a polynomial of degree 4*(k-2)+1.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325 (rows 0..50)
T. R. S. Walsh and A. B. Lehman, Counting rooted maps by genus. III: Nonseparable maps, J. Combinatorial Theory Ser. B 18 (1975), 222-259, Table VIIIa.
formula: G.f.: A(x,y) satisfies A(x,y) = G(x*A(x,y)^2),y) where G(x,y) + x*(1+y) is the g.f. of A342984.
program: (PARI) \\ here G(n,y) is A342984 as g.f.
H(n)={my(g=G(n, y)-x*(1+y), v=Vec(sqrt(serreverse(x/g^2)/x))); vector(#v, n, Vecrev(v[n], n))}
xref: Columns and diagonals 3..5 are A006428, A006429, A006430.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 03 2021
